Name: Johnny Hayes
Notes: Time was officially recorded as 2:55:18 2/5.[38] Italian Dorando Pietri finished in 2:54:46.4, but was disqualified for receiving assistance from race officials near the finish.[39] Note.[40]

Name: Hannes Kolehmainen
Notes: The course distance was officially reported to be 42,750 meters/26.56 miles,[46] however, the Association of Road Racing Statisticians estimated the course to be 40 km.[14]

Name: Fusashige Suzuki
Notes: According to the Association of Road Racing Statisticians, Suzuki's 2:27:49 performance occurred in Tokyo on March 21, 1935 during a race in which he finished second to Sohn Kee-chung (sometimes referred to as Kee-Jung Sohn or Son Kitei) who ran a 2:26:14.[49]
